description.h2: If an element used in an instance is the target in the instance DTS of more than one effective presentation relationship in a base set with the same source element, then the presentation relationships must have distinct values of the preferredLabel attribute.
description.p: This rule prevents the same fact from appearing twice in a set of line items, except when it is, for example, shown as both the beginning and ending value of a roll forward.

variation.name: 6.12.5 Instance has a fact whose primary element is presented twice, once with a preferred label, GOOD.
variation.description: Instance has a fact whose primary element is presented twice, once with a preferred label, GOOD

variation.name: 6.12.5 Instance has a fact whose primary element is presented twice with distinct preferred labels, GOOD.
variation.description: Instance has a fact whose primary element is presented twice with distinct preferred labels, GOOD

variation.name: 6.12.5 Instance has a fact whose primary element is presented twice without any preferred label, NOGOOD.
variation.description: Instance has a fact whose primary element is presented twice without any preferred label, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.12.5 Instance has a fact whose primary element is presented twice with the same preferred label, NOGOOD.
variation.description: Instance has a fact whose primary element is presented twice with the same preferred label, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.12.5 Primary element is presented twice with the same preferred label, not used in instance, GOOD.
variation.description: Primary element is presented twice with the same preferred label, not used in instance, GOOD.
